title: Warhol and Prince Case Could Shake Up Copyright Law
itunes:title: Warhol and Prince Case Could Shake Up Copyright Law
description:
Intellectual property litigator Terence Ross, a partner at Katten Muchin Rosenmann, discusses Supreme Court oral arguments over whether Andy Warhol's silkscreen series of Prince infringed the copyright of a photographer.
Kimberly Strawbridge Robinson, Bloomberg Law Supreme Court Reporter, discusses why the Solicitor General's Office remains a pipeline for diversity in Supreme Court oral arguments.
June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
